issue.title: Atlas v4 has a wry2 joint

content.raw:
Note also related earlier question in #467.

Also related, it was proposed to split atlas_description from drcsim, which could make things more modular, and easier to fork and modify: #451
We soft of did this and added a "atlas_v4_no_wry2" model for use with the real robot as Doug suggests. The changes are pretty straightforward, see [vigir_atlas_common](https://github.com/team-vigir/vigir_atlas_common) repo and  [atlas_v4 -> atlas_v4_no_wry2 changeset](https://github.com/team-vigir/vigir_atlas_common/commit/b4d9f45c1e5a94adb151d39192647eaa3afd4cb5)

/edit: Note the link pointed to the wrong changeset before, just fixed that.
content.html:
Note also related earlier question in #467.

Also related, it was proposed to split atlas_description from drcsim, which could make things more modular, and easier to fork and modify: #451 We soft of did this and added a "atlas_v4_no_wry2" model for use with the real robot as Doug suggests. The changes are pretty straightforward, see vigir_atlas_common repo and atlas_v4 -> atlas_v4_no_wry2 changeset
